intro: Mentha × sativa var. flexuosa, commonly known as catnip, is a hybrid species within the mint family (Lamiaceae). It is characterized by its square, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically purple or pink, arranged in whorls along the stem. It is a perennial herb that thrives in moist, well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. This variety is notable for its aromatic properties and is widely used in traditional medicine and as a natural insect repellent.
